dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOMING UP and OVER the fence, the yard is a veritable maze of old, rusted cars, piled up helter skelter, frozen in time. Broken glass, mangled engine parts, garbage and litter... along with hundreds of spent shell casings, are scattered in the dirt. A caravan of UTILITY VEHICLES ROARS in behind the semi, the convoy making a bead for the center of the yard. Picking up the rear is a black Rolls-Royce Phantom II. As they turn the last corner, the first thing we see are “unearthly” flares. Dozens of them, bright as hell, lighting up the middle of the graveyard. The CARS come SKIDDING to a stop. Dust swirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear door opens, and CYRUS KRITICOS, 50s, wealthy, immaculately dressed, not a hair out of place, steps out. His hand rests on a shiny, silver-headed cane. He surveys the flares, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Their little crusade is wearing thin.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll give them this... they are consistent. Stepping out next is DENNIS RAFKIN, 20s, unshaven, jittery. He holds his head in his hands, massaging his temples, obviously in pain. (NOTE: Whenever we cut to Rafkin we hear/sense a piercing tone, underscoring the psychic waves he's receiving.) Cyrus produces a thin, brown designer cigarette from a silver case. Taps it as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: As cancer... (lights his cigarette) Never bet against human nature, Dennis. You'll always lose. Behind him, Rafkin suddenly lurches forward, racked by spasms. Cyrus turns, with slight concern --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Is it bad tonight?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (coughing, shaking) Bad is one way of describing it, but somehow... (wiping his sweaty forehead) ... insane seems more appropriate. Rafkin doubles over in pain. Dry heaves.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (recovering) It's my professional opinion that we get the hell out of here. Now. Two of Cyrus's team, dressed in assault gear, make their way over. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 3.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (ignoring Rafkin, re: flares) Noted. Clean this place up, and locate our guests. Cyrus snaps his fingers. An ASSISTANT steps forward with a large photo. When Cyrus turns around, he catches Rafkin gulping down prescription drugs. Cyrus strikes the bottle out of Rafkin's hand with his cane. Pink medicine runs down Rafkin's face as he turns with rage.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Come on, Cyrus, I gotta take the edge off.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: You know the routine. First things first. Now where is he? Cyrus holds it in the limo headlights; an aerial photo of the graveyard. Rafkin, closing his eyes, reaches out towards the photo with one hand, then touches the earth with the other. A silent moment.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Where? Then a huge spark arcs between the psychic and the ground. Rafkin jolts back, as if shocked.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus, Cyrus, there's got to be over forty victims here! I thought you said this guy killed twenty people.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Twenty when he was alive. He's added a few more since then. Now where's the Breaker, Dennis? Rafkin ignores the photo, and points at a spot deep inside the auto graveyard. Cyrus grabs a headset from the Assistant.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (into microphone) All teams go to alpha. I repeat!--  THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teams of men pile out of the vehicles. The back of the semi is opened, revealing racks of remote-operated amplifiers. Others unload inch-thick, eight-foot-square sheets of glass, rimmed with aluminum pipe, and inscribed with ancient text. The glass sheets are assembled to form a large cube. Arrays of flood lamps illuminate the canyons of the wrecking yard in stark white. One side of the cube remains open... allowing entry and -- ready to come down in theory, and close the improvised "mousetrap." Rafkin walks up behind Cyrus, still massaging his temples.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Where'd he get a name like the Breaker anyway? He a truck driver?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: It's simply folklore at work. The local color exorcising its demons... Just then, a hideous HOWL ECHOES through the night -- part human, part God-knows-what. Everyone stops. Rafkin swallows hard. Tosses away the empty prescription drugs bottle, then opens an extra-large jar of aspirin, pops a few into his mouth, crunches them like mints.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: «++. Or maybe it's because he broke his victims into as many pieces as possible. (exhaling smoke) Who's to say...?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Cute... A shrill cacophony of METAL AND GLASS erupts from the maze of the graveyard. A large, dense object flies out of the darkness and crashes down in front of them in a cloud of dust. It's a crushed car. Cyrus sighs... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 5.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: I hate being rushed.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Cyrus, this one ain't like the others... (off the teams) Do they know what we're up against?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: These men are well paid. That's all they need to know.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: But this is suicide...

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Then I'll match their price... and yours.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You don't have that kind of money.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised... now get to work. This takes Rafkin by surprise. He turns, taking a step towards Cyrus. Cyrus backs up, his cane instantly at Rafkin's chest, keeping him distant. Rafkin becomes suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What are you hiding, old man?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Careful, Dennis, curiosity killed the cat.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch! They both turn to see four team members dragging an attractive man and woman, DAMON QUINTEROS and KALINA ORETZIA, over to Cyrus. Damon's a handsome chap with a righteous fire in his eyes. Kalina, his lover, is equally fiery, late 20s, tough and sexy. She cradles in her arms an ancient book.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: How can you possibly justify what you're doing, Cyrus? It's out and out slavery. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 6.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Aw, jeezus, here we go again.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Damon Quinteros and Kalina Oretzia. Every time I hunt must I scrape you off the bottom of my shoes?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: These aren't animals you're trapping! They're human beings!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Why don't you guys go join Greenpeace or throw blood on the old ladies' fur coats, for Christ's sake... we have business.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: (to Cyrus) Bastard! Who are you to play God?!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Playing's for children. I'm going to be God.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You'll never pull it off! Not without the right spells. That and the thirteenth ghost! Rafkin turns, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Thirteenth?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Get them out of my sight. We've wasted enough time as it is. The team straps Damon and Kalina to some car wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on headphones) All teams in position, Mr. Kriticos.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Excellent... set up the transmitters. Cyrus turns away from them as he slips on a pair of ghost glasses. The rest of the team around the graveyard do so as well. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cyrus starts to climb a wall of cars for a better view of his battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Wait a minute! The Breaker's number twelve! You said we needed twelve!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Yes, and then one more. I thought you were psychic.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You know it doesn't work like that --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: We haven't got the time to argue... (into microphone) Now bring in the bait! Nearby, a silver tanker rolls into the canyon of cars.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (into mike) We never needed bait before --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (into mike) Insurance. I can't afford to lose this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEAM MEMBER opens the truck's valve: Huge streams of blood gush out from both sides, via two nozzles, flooding the area around the cube. Rafkin's jaw drops. ON Cyrus, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Power up the cube! Somewhere a switch is thrown and the cube lights up. The symbols etched on its surfaces glow a brilliant green. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 8.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (into mike) Base. Start transmitting.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over headset) But we haven't recalled the teams yet. They'll be stuck out there with --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (into mike) Just start the transmission!

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: You heard the man. Start broadcasting the spells -- Another tech flips a switch, rolling a reel-to-reel deck. We BOOM OUT the door TO the antenna, and hear a HIGH- FREQUENCY WHINE, mixed with the sound of repetitive CHANTING. Spells being read, over and over in Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep inside, at the sound of the CHANTING, there comes another ungodly HOWL, angrier than before.

dialogues.speaker: WITH TEAMS
dialogues.text: Along the perimeter, placing the amplifiers, shock instantly registers with the teams when they realize the transmission has begun, leaving them exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere near Cyrus there's an angry HOWL. Cyrus turns and looks out over the auto graveyard, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Come out, come out, wherever you are... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 9.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM TWO LEADER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on headset) We've got movement, Cyrus, heading south -- We hear a CRASH of METAL and, on the headset, a confusion of SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: WITH RAFKIN
dialogues.text: The screams of the men fill the air.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Christ, Cyrus... what have you done? Off to the side, Damon and Kalina strain against the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Dennis, listen! He's not telling you the whole story! His spells won't work with this one. They're not strong enough. Trust me on this... I know... Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Listen to him, Dennis. He knows what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys... I'm just here for the paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see another team race down an alley. They turna corner. One of them slips on something wet. He gets up, realizes he's slipped in the unravelled remains of one of Team Two.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM MEMBER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: TEAM MEMBER
dialogues.text: (looks over partner's shoulder) Mother of... His partner turns as a great shape looms... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Abruptly, something reaches down and snatches a team member up and OUT OF FRAME. His partner glances back, sees his friend yanked up a wall of cars, then into the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosion of blood spatters from inside the broken windshield. A hand struggles against the glass. A friend dies a horrific death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As HIDEOUS SCREAMS fill the air, the Team Member turns and starts climbing the other side. Rafkin rounds a turn, sees the Team Member climbing up the wall of cars. The Team Member looks back as they approach.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM MEMBER
dialogues.text: Run! It's right behind me -- Suddenly, a SQUEAL of METAL as something invisible reaches through the grill of the car and grabs the Team Member by the waist. He screams as he is folded over, backwards, and yanked into the grill of the car. Rafkin rushes toward him. We hear BONES BREAK as the Team Member screams. The Breaker, unseen on the far side of the heap of cars, yanks on his victim, over and over, smashing the Team Member's chin against the grill, trying to pull him through. Rafkin does the best he can to pull the man free, but it seems hopeless. The man screams and screams. Abruptly, Rafkin's efforts seem, at last, to work. With a mighty tug, he tumbles back and falls to the ground. Looks down and sees that he holds only the man's foot. The wall of cars begins to move before Rafkin. He leaps just as the wall comes crashing down. Rafkin scrambles and runs full bore back the way he came. He looks back, speaks into his mike:

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Cyrus, the spells aren't working! He's tearing this place apart! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on headset) Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You calm down! The son-of-a-bitch is throwing cars at me!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on headset) History has no time for cowards, Mr. Rafkin.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: History's all we're gonna be in about two seconds!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin turns a corner and runs past two team members heading in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hey, goddamnit, you're running the wrong way! They don't slow down.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (to himself) Amateurs... Rafkin turns a corner and realizes why the team members were running this way. A car at the end of this alley is tipped up on its bumper, its undercarriage facing them, and is moving toward them, fast. Rafkin and another team member, deeper in the alley, hear the HOWL of the Breaker behind the floating car.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ! Run!! Rafkin runs, but the team member doesn't, stunned by the sight, remains frozen. Suddenly the car stops -- and lifts straight up into the air over him.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST VISION GLASSES
dialogues.text: The Breaker comes INTO CLEAR VIEW for a fraction of a second. He's huge, seven feet tall, acromegalic, the bones beneath the skin swollen and distorted. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stares with burning eyes above a huge distended jaw. He wears, prosaically, a filthy tattered garage uniform, his name stitched above the pocket. His face, chest and arms are pockmarked with bullet holes dating from his untimely death. He takes the car that he holds overhead and slams it down. The team member dodges out of the way, but the Breaker picks up the car again and slams it down again, squashing him. And then, again. And then, for good measure, once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin tears down the alleyway. He turns a corner just as the wall behind him collapses. He's looking down a passage filled with team members, with the cube serving as its plug: a dead end. It seems the Breaker has everyone trapped, instead of vice versa. Everyone runs toward the cube, splashing through pools of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team members and Rafkin scatter before us. Men climb up the walls of wreckage as the invisible Breaker plows through, sending men flying high into the air. Rafkin slams hard against the wall, drops to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team member runs, looks over his shoulder at the pursuing Breaker. He doesn't see where he's going and runs straight against a blood-splashed glass wall. He's blundered into the glass cube. In an instant, the Breaker's inside with him. His entry trips an unseen switch. The final glass wall slides down, sealing the cube. As it does, the howling, and the team member's screams, drop to silence. Inside the cube, something awful happens, but we can't see through the smears of blood. Rafkin regains his senses, scrambles towards the cube. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: No! Oh, Christ, no -- Inside the cube, the Breaker turns, realizes he's been trapped, launches himself at the bloody sheet of glass, presses his face to it, howls. Rafkin recoils as the Breaker pounds at the glass. With each ghostly blow, the symbol glows red, but the glass seems to have the power to contain the force: it holds.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Oh, that piss you off, does it? You know what pisses me off? A dead_guy throwing Buicks at me! Rafkin eyes the horror, then tugs off his glasses. The Breaker disappears. Rafkin collapses in exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (into microphone) I gotta hand it to you, Cyrus, the bait worked. You got your dozen now. Happy? (beat) Cyrus?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (screaming, desperate) Help! Somebody, please! Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin rounds a pile of cars, and sees... Kalina, on the ground, holding a dying Damon in her arms. His throat has been slit, and Kalina holds her hand over the gash, trying to keep him from dying. But it's no use... he dies. Kalina sobs. Rafkin's in awe, perhaps ashamed. Rafkin turns nervously away. And there, he sees Cyrus's Assistant lying, dead, bloody and broken. And beyond him, lies Cyrus himself. Cyrus's neck has been pierced by a long, metal shard. His eyes stare, cold and dead. Rafkin brings his hands to his head, distraught, almost weepy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 14.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Cyrus... oh, man... look at you... There goes my bonus. Suddenly, someone grabs his arm, and spins him around. It's Kalina. She's sobbing and shaking Cyrus's glasses in Rafkin's face.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Was it worth it? Huh? Playing God! Was it...? OFF Rafkin's shell-shocked look, we PAN OVER to see the ghost of one of the techs, ripped apart and bloody, studying the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright, sunny day... THROUGH a glass window we see and hear two children out playing in the yard. A Norman Rockwell, picture-perfect setting... A young boy and a teenage girl romp in the grass, then up to the window steps a beautiful woman, fresh from the garden. It's obvious she's the mother of these two. Over the giggling of the kids she smiles at ARTHUR KRITICOS, 50, sitting inside his bedroom, in a very comfortable chair, taking in his family with pride. We PAN TO Arthur as he smiles, content... A sharp KNOCK on the bedroom door breaks the mood, and Arthur turns. Our UNCUT CAMERA CONTINUES TO PAN TO the door. As it does, it SWEEPS ACROSS a desk decorated with family photos, one of which is the woman at the window. CAMERA CONTINUES TO the door, where we notice the wall and door around KATHY, Arthur's 21-year-old daughter, has somehow aged from the pristine room we thought we were in. Kathy sticks her head in. Pretty if she ever had time to fix her hair, clad in a University of Calumny sweatshirt. She stirs a pan of burnt scrambled eggs.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad... it's almost eight-thirty... shake a leg. You'll miss your first class. And could you tell Maggie to get the hell out of the bathroom. She had her five minutes twenty minutes ago. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door slams shut again. Our UNCUT CAMERA CONTINUES TO PAN AROUND the room. As it does, the walls begin to age drastically, pictures disappearing, books vanishing from their shelves. The room, and all its promise, simply slip away. By the time we GET TO the bed, we notice only one side is occupied. The other lies fallow. Our UNCUT CAMERA RETURNS TO Arthur, who sits, unshaven, in a decrepit chair, staring out at the brick wall lying just outside the window, not ten feet from him. Gone is the world he knew, the beauty of a home, the sounds of a family laughing in the summertime heat. They are replaced by the angry cacophony of the inner city streets, its claustrophobic conditions, its hopeless yoke. Our CAMERA CONTINUES PAST Arthur, RETURNING TO the desk. All are gone save one; the picture of his wife, which sits charred and frameless, propped up against a stack of bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur comes out of the bathroom and beholds, in the kitchenette of his small, cramped three-bedroom apartment... A blur of activity: Kathy cooks at the stove, his son BOBBY, 7, eats a bowl of cereal at the kitchen table, while scanning the obituary section of the newspaper. He records the different, humorous deaths with a microphone and a tape recorder. In the b.g., on the TELEVISION, a black and white horror movie drones on (the original Thirteen Ghosts). The nanny, MAGGIE, 26, just gets in the way... wiping the counter, pouring the OJ, setting the table. It's a very disorganized way of doing things. She's trying, sort of, but we can see from Kathy's body language that she's at her wits' end with the woman.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Today on ‘Death in Manhattan This Morning,' we notice a small leap in heart attacks in the city, cancer deaths are down. And we have a special treat for everyone!-- a body was found this morning decapitulated, decapilated, de-- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maggie cracks up. Kathy turns toward him, nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Bobby. Find a healthier hobby. Bobby shuts off the tape recorder, angry at the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kathy, I'm broadcasting! Arthur enters, chipper.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: ‘Morning, everyone!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad, they found a guy without a head in a dumpster behind Dunkin' Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: That's nice. Maggie ruffles Bobby's hair. Arthur pours himself a cup of coffee, sidles up to Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Kathy, why don't you let Maggie make breakfast? That's why I hired her.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (also sotto) Have you tasted her cooking? Kathy makes a gagging response while scooping eggs onto the first of three places on the counter. He looks at the eggs burned in effigy but continues smiling.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad, will you tell Kathy that keeping a record of deaths is healthy because it's in the interest of science?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy, it's healthy.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She's being a real slut about it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Bobby, don't call your sister a slut.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: A term like 'bitch' would be more appropriate. ‘Slut' is a term reserved for those of loose sexual morals, something, to be perfectly frank, Kathy could use a bit more of.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Ha. Ha.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Well, it's true, girl. When's the last time you had a date? Arthur pretends to not be disturbed by the conversation around him, smiling and nodding.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Why are you smiling?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm pretending you're all perfectly normal. It's working pretty well, too... Arthur turns toward the table, and holding a plate of food and his coffee...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Hey, Edgar Allan Poe, you finish your homework? Mr. Petersen tells me you aren't -- ... trips on Bobby's scooter. The hot coffee spills all over him. He falls back into the counter, knocking the pan of eggs to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, that's the third time I tripped on that thing, Bobby. Get it off the floor before it kills someone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sorry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (to herself) If we had a bigger place we wouldn't have this problem!--

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (overhearing her) Well, we don't have a bigger place, so let's just keep our stuff off the floor. Alright? Arthur wipes off his pants, but it's just one big stain. Suddenly, there's a BUZZ at the DOOR. Everyone goes silent... Kathy looks to Arthur, who checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Shit... I forgot, the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: What lawyer? (beat) I thought our credit was all cleaned up?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No, no. It's not that. Arthur goes to the door, mopping his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Mr. Kriticos?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Brad Moss?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (outstretches his hand) Ben, yes, how do you do? Arthur shakes his hand. Ben can't help but notice the stain in Arthur's trousers.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Fine. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Now a good time?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Couldn't be better.  19 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits at the kitchen table. Bobby is dressed for school, Arthur is changed. Ben sets up a laptop computer.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: As you know, I represent the estate of your Uncle Cyrus Kriticos.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I didn't know you have an Uncle Cyrus.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Had. I met him a couple of times as a kid. My dad always disliked him. Said he squandered the family fortune.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: We have a family fortune?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Well, no. Cyrus squandered it. Didn't I just say that?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) Isn't this exciting? You have a late uncle!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What's he late for?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: His next birthday.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (the penny drops) You mean he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Now we get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This message was recorded by Cyrus six months ago. He asked that it be played for you in the event of his death... Ben inserts a DVD into the laptop. Cyrus's image appears on the screen, distorted from the angle of the monitor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on computer ) Arthur. Good to talk to you. Ben tilts the screen forward. Cyrus comes clearly into view. He smokes one of his thin brown cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on computer ) Sadly, if you're watching me now, that means I am no longer among the living. Happily, that makes you and your family my sole beneficiaries. The family members look at one another with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on computer ) I've instructed my lawyer, Mr. Moss, to deliver to you the essentials of my last will and testament. Ben produces a small box, lays it on the table, opens it. Inside the silk-lined interior is a large, odd-looking key.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: A key?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: A key to what?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on computer ) A key to your new house. A series of windows on the computer screen open to reveal a series of photos of an astonishing modernist masterpiece. We see the interiors. Living room, bedrooms, kitchen, bathrooms. Everyone at the table gasps.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Bathrooms. Look, every bedroom has a bathroom!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on computer ) This house is the fruit of my life's work. It's a one-of-a-kind home. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (then) I've led an interesting life, seen many amazing things. The only regret I have is that I never really got to know my nephew Arthur. This house is my attempt to make up for that. Enjoy. Perhaps we will meet again in another life. Cyrus smiles. The screen goes blank. Arthur can't believe his eyes. Nor his good fortune.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: When can we see it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The house is yours. Whenever you like.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (to Arthur) Can we go tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (to Arthur) I'm planning on heading out there after work. The directions're a little fuzzy. If you want to, your wife and kids could follow me out --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'm not his wife. Kathy rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: My wife, um, she um --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Our mom got burnt to death ina fire.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Bobby...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What? It's true. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Robert. That's enough. (to Ben) So where is this place?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: A couple hours away.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Great, we can stay the night, and come back in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: We're not staying the night.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Because you have school in the morning, and I have to teach. We'll go look at it, but we're coming home tonight. (to Kathy) Deal? A smile creeps across Kathy's face giving her answer... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN AROUND the cluttered closed office at newspaper clippings hanging on the wall. Black and white photos of newly dug up graves. Autopsy pictures of about a dozen deceased individuals, articles underneath each picture describing their deaths. It's a gruesome, graphic, reportage of things we'd rather not think about. The first is a suicide victim, found with her wrists slashed in her bathtub. Another's an archery accident involving a little boy. The list goes on and_= on, ending with a serial killer, one Frank Mahoney, a.k.a. the Breaker. CONTINUE PANNING past books on the Occult, and Damon's PHd degree in Parapsychology. We LAND ON Kalina herself, stuffing her worn satchel. A lamp illuminates an ancient book in front of her with handwritten notes and drawings inside. She closes the book and stuffs it in her satchel. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PULL IN TIGHT ON a short newspaper article, featuring a photo of Cyrus:

dialogues.speaker: "NOTED ADVENTURER DIES AT 57"
dialogues.text: In the article, underlined in red pen, are the words, “survived by one Arthur Kriticos..." CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben drives, he checks his rearview mirror for Arthur and family, to see if they're keeping up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur drives with Kathy beside him. Bobby and Maggie are in the back seat, playing hangman. His microphone's lying on the seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: C'mon... you're taking too long.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: S... U... F... suffocate! I got it! I win!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys, we're almost there. Arthur can tell his daughter's anxious.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Excited?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom would've freaked over this.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (chuckles sadly) You're right... Kathy looks out the window. An awkward beat passes between them...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: So you looking forward to going back to school? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad. I've been thinking...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Maybe I shouldn't, you know, go back. I could skip a year, be with you guys --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy. C'mon, you can't do that... remember how proud Mom was when that acceptance letter showed up in the mail.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I know, I just don't know what you guys are gonna do without me. Kathy's face flushes with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Baby. Bobby and I will manage. Besides, things look like they just got a little better.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but that's not the point. It's just that... every smile you have is --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Honey --

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: It's... not real, Dad. Arthur's affected by her words.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I loved her too. But sooner or later you've got to stop blaming yourself.

dialogues.speaker: 22A
dialogues.text: Arthur pulls up behind Ben's car in the f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby looks through the front window, between Kathy and his dad.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Cool! Everyone reacts...

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad, it's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous and majestic house made of glass nestled amongst pine trees. Stark against the evening sky, the house is awe-inspiring. Even for an English teacher, Arthur has a hard time finding the words. There's also a Power & Light truck parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group approaches the front door. It looks unusual, yes, but it's also an undeniable architectural marvel.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's strange. A young man appears, waiting in the solitary light of the porch, a clipboard in his hand and a tool belt slung over his shoulder. He's dressed in a Power & Light uniform, and ON CLOSER INSPECTION we see that it's Rafkin, in disguise. He approaches the family.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: ‘Bout time someone got here. You the owners?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Who're you?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: The power guy. I don't know if you're aware of it, but this place keeps knocking out the power in the tri-quad area. So if you don't mind, I need to check the breakers inside. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Couldn't you come back tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Well, I could -- I mean, I could Ben turns now. -- but, man, they frown upon that sort of thing, my bosses.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's not our problem --

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Look, I've only been doing this job for, like, three weeks. If you could find it in your hearts --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Sure. to Arthur. After all, it is Arthur's house

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Arthur, Arthur Kriticos. Rafkin hides his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Quite a place you got here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah... we're movin' in.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: One step at a time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the main structure is an entryway, with an inner and outer door, almost like an airlock. Arthur produces the odd key and slips it into the keyhole. The locking mechanism, visible within the glass, beckons. Arthur turns the key. As it turns, we hear the MECHANISM CLICK and WHIR. Then, oddly, the key is sucked into the keyhole, Everyone and vanishes. looks at the now-empty keyhole, then at each other, then back at the keyhole. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: That's... odd.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Must've, um, slipped into the mechanism. We'll have to get that looked at.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: That didn't look like it slipped to me. I got a cousin who could fix that --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad, you broke it!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Bobby, go to a station break, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Give it a rest. Bobby reluctantly clicks off the recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the basement of the house, in a dark space we see a tiny pendulum within a delicate, antique set of gears come to life. AS we PULL AWAY, runes of odd description come INTO VIEW, etched on ivory plates, the plates attached to levers and meters standing poised, waiting... The lights in the room suddenly flicker on. We PULL AWAY FROM the odd bits of machinery, seeing it for what it is: a control panel of some kind. Our RETREATING CAMERA then becomes engulfed by what looks to be a huge set of gears, made of brass and steel, standing by. We PULL OUT the other side of the gears, viewing the machinery's massive size, the gears works nearly fifteen feet high, dominating a room filled with pulleys and steel cable.  THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flicker on from within the house, allowing us to see inside. The most striking thing about it is that the house is entirely transparent. Even the interior walls are made of glass, putting the furniture, fixtures and all the expensive-looking antique decorations on stark display. Everyone stares at the alarming edifice, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: How. Weird.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Apparently Cyrus wasn't too keen on privacy.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I hope the bathroom's in the basement. Arthur pushes the door open, and they enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group comes into the entryway. Like an airlock, the outer door closes before the inner one will open.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I did mention I don't do windows, didn't I? The walls of the entryway are lined with rare ancient documents in exquisite cases, archeological treasures, recognizably priceless antiques. The group looks around, amazed. With fascination, Arthur studies the text on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Latin...

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad, this stuff must be worth a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah. That occurred to me. With a huge smile Bobby reaches for an ancient samurai sword on display. Arthur catches him in mid act.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: In your dreams, kiddo. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 29.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They come to a great hall, a soaring open space with a large stained glass ceiling and, strangely, an equally large brass and copper floor. With only one other door at its opposite end, the room is a great glass cube.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Ohhh, Cyrus. What did you do...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Okay. First rule. No throwing stones.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It's marvelous, isn't it? A living work of art. A few chuckles. But Rafkin looks troubled. Sweat beads on his forehead. His head is killing him, and he's rubbing incessantly on his temples.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Excuse me, the sooner you show me where you hid the basement the sooner I'm outta here --

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I believe it's down the hall, second door on the right. Rafkin walks off, holding his head, leaving the others still examining the house. Bobby's eye catches on the design in the floor made of a series of concentric metal rings. There's a brass disk in the center, two feet in diameter, with symbols etched into its surface, spinning slowly. Bobby goes to place his foot on it, when Arthur lifts him up.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Don't touch anything. At least until we got some property insurance. He places Bobby down beside Kathy and Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Arthur, we have some papers to sign in the library. After that, I'll give you a tour of the place. Arthur turns to the three of them. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I don't want you guys to move from this spot. We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad --

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What happened to checking out our new digs?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You can see it all from here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad... you're being paranoid and overprotective.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah... of all this stuff. I know you guys too well. (points to spot) Stay. Right. Here. I mean it. The three of them nod, appeasing him. Arthur and Ben walk off. After a beat, Kathy, Maggie and Bobby slip away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin descends the stairs. Downstairs is a maze of narrow glass corridors. Not much else. It's all very clean and sterile. Not a spider web in the joint. In fact, there's nothing alive down here. Rafkin removes a pair of ghost glasses. Slips them on. An AUDIO PIERCING GAINS in VOLUME with every step Rafkin takes.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Alright, you sick bastard, where'd you put my money? As soon as Rafkin reaches the bottom step, he's assaulted full force by the psychic waves around him.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Aaahh!! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He keels over and vomits. The assault becomes too much, he collapses against a wall When he doubles over in pain... we reveal a ghost behind him in the glass. It's a teenager from the '50s, a high- schooler in a letterman's coat, the victim of a horrific auto crash. He holds a baseball bat menacingly over his shoulder. Rafkin, sensing its proximity, turns as the ghost swings the bat with all his might. Instinctively Rafkin leaps back, but the glass holding the ghost holds. With exception of the red symbols that EXPLODE across its surface, the barrier remains intact. But the ghost within is suddenly gone... Rafkin lands with fright a few feet back up the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus... not you. As he turns about him, another ghost launches out of the darkness at him, only to be stopped by the glass. It's an older, Pilgrimess woman in stocks. Rafkin's jolted by this vision. He's driven to the other side of the hallway. Again, when he turns around, the ghost is gone. He turns to face the Fat Man and the Little Woman ghosts. This sends him flying. Rafkin races back down the corridor in shock. Soon he's lost in the underground maze of glass, confused by all the twists and turns. He finally reaches the foot of the stairs. And bolts up them.. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ancient weapons are displayed hanging on the walls. Arthur and Ben take them in.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Was Cyrus a hunter? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 32.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You could say that. Arthur's attention is now drawn to the rare collection of books piled up against the walls. We PAN, FOLLOWING Arthur, discovering a pair of ghost glasses on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: This is incredible, Chaucer, Dickens, Hemingway... these are all first editions. Arthur carefully handles the books.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Your uncle was quite a collector. Of many things. Ben removes a folder of papers from his briefcase. Lays them across the desk. Hands Arthur a pen. Arthur reluctantly pulls himself away from collection.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I've highlighted where you're supposed to sign. (indicating) First here -- Arthur takes the pen from him, pauses.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't want to bring this up in front of the kids. This place... it's amazing, and we're extremely grateful, believe me, but I don't know how we can afford it... I'm just a teacher... and the taxes on it must be... well, to be honest... (long beat, almost to himself) ... a fire took away everything we had...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not to worry, Arthur, your uncle was a genius with finances. He took care of everything. Estate taxes. Inheritance taxes, you name it. You'll never have to worry about money ever again. Arthur takes this in. Scans the documents. Finds the highlighted area, and is just about to sign, when... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 33.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Arthur!! Arthur looks up and sees -- Rafkin standing in the doorwa looking horrible, out of breath, trying like hell to shed the vomit-stained Power & Light jumpsuit he's been wearin

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (panicked, rambling) We gotta talk. Arthur looks with panic at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What the hell's wrong with the breakers?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: My name's Dennis Rafkin, and I --

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Shit, you're Dennis Rafkin? (to Arthur) My office warned me about this guy.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (an urgency in his voice) You gotta listen to me... this is gonna be hard to swallow... but I used to hunt displaced spiritual energy... with your uncle.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: ... P.K. agents, Revenants, Eidolons, Umbras, wraiths... any of this ring a bell? Arthur looks back and forth from the lawyer to the vomit- stained psychic, thoroughly confused. Rafkin takes a beat

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Alright, let's do this the easy way. Ghosts, Arthur. I used to hunt ghosts with your uncle Cyrus and --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Ghosts?? Ben starts laughing, more loudly than is appropriate. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 34,

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes, stating the obvious) Disgruntled souls trapped on earth because of unfinished business, yes. (to Arthur) Listen, you gotta get your kids and get the hell out of here, now.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This is one for the books. I never met a real live lunatic before.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hey, asshole, I'm not talking to you. You can stay in here as long as you want. (to Arthur) I know it sounds crazy, but this is serious. The basement is filled with containment cubes. If I were you --

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Arthur, this guy's been calling my office since your uncle died. I see it all the time. Some rich guy passes away, and then all the nuts come out. Next thing you know, he'll be claiming Cyrus owed him money.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You're damn right he did. It's bad enough I had to, um talk your secretary into telling me where you'd be so I could get paid -- oh, by the way, she genuinely thinks you're a real bucket of shit -- (to Arthur) But I don't give a damn about that. All I care about is getting my ass outta here. I suggest you do the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: same.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what's going on, but -- Rafkin's headache starts in again, hard. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 35.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Shit, either one of you got any aspirin, ibuprofen, acetaminophen, Midol? Anything, I --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You alright? He finds a bottle of pain relievers in his pocket, tries to get it open, but his fingers are trembling in pain.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Goddamn childproof caps... Rafkin fumbles with the bottle. Arthur reaches out to give him a hand. When he makes contact, Rafkin receives a series of flashes:

dialogues.speaker: 29A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Jean's in front of the sliding glass doors, with the kids outside playing. The images begin to BLUR and pound forward with amazing speed, then -- END OF FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. You okay? Rafkin looks around, registering where he is. On the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, shit, my head... Arthur reaches out to help him up. Rafkin recoils.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Don't. Touch me. Rafkin sits up and looks around, can't see Ben.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Where'd Alley McBeal go? (cover 'where'd the suit go?") CuT TO:  30 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 35A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's heading downstairs, the same way Rafkin just came. When he gets to the bottom of the stairs he takes out a pen light, and flicks it on. Starts to head down the center corridor. Now we're thinking to ourselves, what the hell's this guy doing, and where the hell's he going? To make matters worse, he removes a pair of those ghost glasses from his pocket. Slips them on. Now we're even more curious...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Power guy... what an idiot...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST GLASSES
dialogues.text: He passes by the first room. inside is the 1950s Ritchie Cunningham look-alike. He shoulders his bat, watching Moss's every move through dead eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey, Babe Ruth, stop staring... As Ben passes, the ghost suddenly disappears. He moves on... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Inside the next is a boy, sevenish, holding a tomahawk, dressed in a cowboy outfit with a hunting arrow through his head.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Next time learn to duck... He turns a corner, following the path known only to him. It leads the lawyer to a dead end. Ben feels along the edge of the panel. The glass door snaps open, lightning fast. Ben grins, then carefully steps in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben makes his way around the huge gear works, and approaches the control panel. Smiling, the lawyer spots a black briefcase sitting on a scale next to the mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I gotta hand it to you, Cyrus Kriticos, you're a man of your word. Ben picks up the briefcase; as he does, it sets off a trigger beneath it. The house begins to make noises. Behind him, GEARS GRINDING, WHIRRING, CLICKING, CLUNKING. Something has been turned on. Ben hardly notices; he's intent on the briefcase. He opens it. It's filled with bundles of cash. Ben smiles, still nervous. He closes the briefcase, and leaves the room with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the house we witness the unbelievable. Rooms shift, walls migrate, the whole of the house reconfigures its architecture to accommodate some hidden agenda within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Arthur also witness a change. From their perspective, they can see from the inside what the outside was doing. It's obvious by their shared looks that maybe it's time to take their argument outside. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 34 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 37.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what's going on here, but if you care about that family of yours, get them out of this house. Arthur doesn't need convincing.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'll take your word for it. They quickly rush out of the study, and over to the entryway. But the kids and Maggie are not there...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy... Maggie... Bobby!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers Arthur's cries.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I told them not to leave this spot.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: They're kids, what do you expect?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Alright, fine, you check downstairs, I'll check up. Arthur takes off around the corner. Rafkin stares at the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (to himself) There's no way in hell I'm going back down there... (beat) Time for this psychic to leave... He takes a few steps towards the front door, as Arthur's VOICE ECHOES through the house, looking for his kids.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (hesitating) Shit, shit, shit... Rafkin watches as a set of glass panels close across the front door, sealing them in.  35 36 37 38 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the top of the stairs leading up to the second level, when he hits glass. The stairs have been sealed off from the shift in the house.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Bobby. Kathy! Arthur bangs like a madman on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (begins yelling) Bobby!! Kathy!! Finally the house relents. The glass barrier slides open. Arthur bolts down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben heads back the way he came, wearing the glasses. He walks past the rooms again. As he approaches one, a naked female suicide victim with dead eyes, her wrists slashed, her bloodstained hands wielding a knife, comes up to the glass. Ben stops to check her out.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Life got you down? The Suicide stares at him now with hatred. Her entire eyes are ink black, her face sallow, sucked in, her runny mascara stains cascading down her bloodless cheeks. She launches herself against the glass, clawing and scratching to get to him. Ben shudders, thinking he might've crossed a line, begins to back away. As the basement around Ben Moss suddenly begins to shift. The lawyer turns about, watching with unrest as the mechanical gears all around him engage... shifting rooms... rearranging walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the control panel, the first lever in the row of symbols suddenly shifts forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening doors... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 39 40 41 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ben turns to see the door that held the Suicide back slides open.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hey, I was only kidding... The ghost steps into the hallway towards Ben, blocking the route to the stairs. Ben back-pedals in horror. Backing right into an open doorway... As he steps over the threshold, there's a flicker of light in the doorway, and a sharp SNICK. Ben stands in the doorway, surprised, apparently paralyzed. His glasses tumble off his face, stems sliced through. The briefcase in his hand also seems to be sliced. Half of it falls and halves of dollar bills spill out onto the floor. Ben slowly slides to the ground. Or at least his front half does. The glass door has snapped shut like a razor blade. Bisecting him laterally, slicing straight through his body. His front half slides down, revealing, for a second, a cross sectional view of his back half on the far side of the glass. As Ben's remains collapse wetly to the floor, the Suicide smiles and vanishes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the row of levers we see a series of 13 meters at the base of the pendulum. All read. The needle on the first meter suddenly dives deep into the red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor of the great hall, the RING stops spinning with a CLICK. The symbol on the innermost ring (the same as the one in the basement) has lined up with its mate on the disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, Bobby and Maggie are walking around, examining everything... still excited, oblivious to what's going on downstairs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kathy passes by one of the bedrooms, and breaks off from the other two to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I'll be in here. Bobby and Maggie continue on. Bobby turns on his microphone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (recording) We are now upstairs... and there's... more glass. Bobby clicks off the microphone. Then removes his scooter from his bag.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Race you to the end of the hall...?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I really don't think you should be riding that in -- And suddenly Maggie breaks out into a sprint. Bobby quickly jumps on his scooter, but he's too far behind to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, you cheated! They reach the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That wasn't fair, I didn't say start.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Gotta be on your toes, kid. Maggie walks into one of the rooms. Bobby follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room's filled with all types of cool, macabre, boy stuff. A seven-year-old's dream, if you were a demented seven-year-old.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This is definitely my room. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maggie plops down on a bed made up with skull and crossbones sheets. She finds a pair of ghost glasses lying on the bedside table. Puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: So, do I look cool?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, you look like a dork... But the nanny isn't listening. She sits there, slack- jawed.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (looking through glasses) My God... this is... incredible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The etched glass symbols on the wall have been added to with flowing red, glowing symbols. Not only do they weave in and about the walls, but they create a path on the floor that leads right out the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What? Lemme see.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: One second.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: C'mon... Bobby grabs at them. Maggie takes them off.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Alright, alright... here... Bobby puts them on, and reacts.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Cool! Bobby grabs his scooter and mike, and takes off down the hall. Maggie gives chase, but it's obvious she's not going to catch him. He zooms in and out of the bedrooms, up and down the halls, following the glowing red path. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 42a 43 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 42.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He takes a couple of turns when he realizes he may have gone too far. The boy has become lost in all the glass. Bobby is alone.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Maggie...? Bobby starts scooting again, only this time with a bit more urgency. He passes an open door, which opens into a set of stairs heading down. He stops, backs up, then glances down. At the bottom of the nearest landing, he catches the glimpse of a figure standing. The female figure is in silhouette, and her head is tilted oddly to one side, though from this distance, we can't see why.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kathy?? The figure oddly shuffles off.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Kath, stop playing games. With his scooter under his arm, Bobby heads downstairs, into the darkness of the house.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna tell Dad... CuT TO: INT. CORRIDOR 42a Maggie looking tired of searching for Bobby. Suddenly something 0.S. catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Whoa... what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy walks in, but not before she notices that, from the hallway, the room appears to be empty. The glass door, we now realize, is "trick" glass.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: This place is awesome. Kathy walks over to the bed. Plops down, sinking into all the silk. Her half-closed eyes tell us -- puurrfect. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 42a.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of her eye, she spots a door ajar, with the lights on inside.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: No way... She slips off the bed, opening the door, revealing her new bathroom. And if ever a room could be carved from a single diamond, this is it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Now that's what I'm talkin' about!  44 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's spectacular. Immaculate. And not only spacious, but appointed. The shelves are stacked with jewel-like bottles of perfume. Kathy's wet dream. As we VIEW her FROM BENEATH the glass shelves, she begins inspecting her own found treasure. Everything seems to be unashamedly brand-new.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: We've struck gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she also doesn't notice is a pair of ghost glasses lying on the sink. The CAMERA ZOOMS IN THROUGH the lenses, so that we're now looking at the scene...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST GLASSES
dialogues.text: And a figure passes behind Kathy, jolting us. The figure heads for the tub. The CAMERA TURNS TOWARDS the figure, REVEALING a new level of hell. There's blood spattered everywhere in the bathroom. We PAN. The gore is overwhelming. Still lost in her personal nirvana, Kathy nonchalantly strolls over to the bathtub, drawing back its bloodstained curtain. In a TIGHT SHOT, she runs the water, which is blood-red. On the CUT, she brings it up to her face where it's warm, clear and perfect. When she leans back a bit, we see the naked female suicide ghost lying in the bloody tub, wrists slashed, eyes staring at Kathy, wickedly. Kathy doesn't see her, because she's not wearing the glasses. Two words are written in blood on the glass walls surrounding the tub:

dialogues.speaker: I'M SORRY
dialogues.text: Kathy's oblivious of the Suicide, lost in the possibilities of her bathroom. Running her hand around the bloody water. She turns the water off... and as soon as she does, a knife pierces the surface of the water.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: It doesn't get any better than this. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 44n THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 44,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Suicide rises up with the rest of her knife, reaching for Kathy, when -- There's BANGING on the bathroom door. Kathy bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: We snap out of the ghost glasses, and the bathroom's back to normal. All clean glass block. An empty tub. Kathy opens the locked bathroom door... and Arthur's standing there, pissed. He yanks her out of the bathroom, into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doin' up here? Didn't I tell you to stay downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Where's your brother?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: With Maggie...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He was with me. They turn to see Maggie walking up to them.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: But he scooted off. He's around here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You're supposed to watch him, that's what I pay you for!

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (starts yelling) Bobby! INT. STAIRCASE 44n Arthur's heading downstairs with Kathy and Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'll find him. But I want you both out of here... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44n 45 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 45. CONTINUED: 44n

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No buts. I want you guys to wait in the car, I'll be out as soon as I find Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Why are you freaking out?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy, just this once, don't argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the bottom of the stairs, and head over to the front door. But there's now a glass barrier in front of it, barring anyone from exit.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: What happened to the door?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Arthur picks up a chair and hurls it at the glass. It bounces off without a dent. He picks it up and starts banging away. Nothing. Over the top of the noise a voice bellows out.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What a night I'm having!

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's sealed shut. They all turn to see Rafkin sitting on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What do you mean it's sealed shut?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I mean, it's sealed shut. What part of that code are you having trouble cracking?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: There must be another way out.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I've looked. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 46A
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 46.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Well, we're gonna look again... right after we find my son. Now get up...

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I'll wait here.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what the hell's going on and I don't know who the hell you are... but my son's missing. So until those questions are answered, you're not leaving my sight. Now get up. Rafkin is startled by Arthur's tone. He reluctantly gets up to help.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Oh. Now you listen to me. Before it was the lawyer... (beat, realizing) ... speaking of lawyers. He split? CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gears kick in once again, and the house comes to life. It's a quick shift. But we notice that the gears are moving at an accelerated rate. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more doors open within the basement. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of the clockworks, two more needles from the 13 meters go out. Three ghosts are now loose... CuT TO:  47 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 46A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is zipping down the hallway on his scooter. He takes the corners at high speed, following the spell markings on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kathy! Come on. As he rounds the next turn too fast, his scooter shoots out from under him, his glasses sail off his head...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Aahh! --. and he lands on his ass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bobby grabs his glasses again, and when he slips them on!--

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST GLASSES
dialogues.text: He sees a decapitated head lying on the floor right between his legs, wrapped in plastic. The head's eyes snap open, and it begins to mouth words. Bobby screams... then he hears a DRAGGING sound behind him, like dead skin slapping on glass. Bobby turns and sees a headless, legless human torso, wrapped in sheets of filthy plastic, crab-walking towards him...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Daaddd!!!! Bobby jumps to his feet, turning. He runs down the hall. Looks back, sees nothing, then when he turns back, straight into the bound woman. Pinned against the glass, the bound woman lets out a muffled cry. Strangled by a businessman's tie, which is still cinched tight around her neck, her tongue sticks out like a thick blue thumb. Her hair, skin, and prom dress are clotted with dirt and worms -- the marks of a shallow grave. Her hands and feet are bound by rope, but that's not the worst. Her head sits askew on her shoulders, neck obviously broken, a chunk of bone jutting out just beneath the skin. Panicked, she goes into violent convulsions. It's too much for Bobby. He turns and bolts, racing blindly through the basement's glass hallways. When finally he feels safe, he slows enough to look over his shoulder, and that's when he slams into a wall of glass. The collision knocks his glasses from his head, his mike from his shoulder. He reaches for his glasses when the tiny sound of a SQUEAKING WHEEL issues FROM his MIKE down the hall. Bobby looks at the mike, then fearfully back at the glasses in his hands. Ushering all his courage, Bobby dons the glasses, and with his heart beating like a hummingbird's, he turns around, and sees... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Another WOMAN there, walking down the corridor towards him. Dressed in only a hospital gown, she wheels a portable IV stand along the floor. Yards of thin plastic Iv tubes tether her to the stand. Her arms, thin, withered from long illness, bear nasty scars from unnumbered operations. Her head is almost completely covered in stained bandages, but a beauty mark decorates that portion of her face we can see. She gropes blindly down the passage, straight towards Bobby. He backs up, trips over his feet, almost falls. The IV Woman stops. So does Bobby. Bobby waits, frozen. He tries to call for help, but can only manage a gasp.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: D-Dad... Daddy... (louder ) Dad! Dad! The IV Woman seems to respond to the sound of his voice. She cocks her head, as if listening. She moves, calling out, but we hear it THROUGH the tiny amplifier of Bobby's TOY MIKE.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on mike) B-bb-bobby? And now he recognizes her voice -- it's his mother, Jean. That's it. Bobby turns and runs like hell. Around the corner, and right into -- Cyrus. Or Cyrus's ghost. Pale white, with eyes rolled back, and a big spike sticking out of his neck. Standing behind a pane of glass. Bobby actually hit glass, and he catches a glimpse of the dead Cyrus just before he's knocked out from the impact. As his glasses and microphone fall to the floor, we... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, Kathy, Maggie and Rafkin are searching the house, looking for Bobby. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 49.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Bobby! !

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Come on out, pal!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Robert!! Stop screwing around!

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hey, Glass Family Robinson! You're wasting your breath! This stuff -- (taps glass) This is Ectobar Glass, Cyrus invented it. It's shatterproof and soundproof. So your kid might have a hard time hearing you. Maggie touches the etchings on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: They're containment spells. Ectoplasmic entities can't cross them. The supernatural has laws to obey just like we do. In the case of ghosts, it's spells. Written, spoken, it doesn't matter. They have to obey what the spells tell them.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: So what do these do?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: At the moment they're keeping us alive

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Just ignore him. Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Let's go back for a second to the ecto-thing...

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You mean the poltergeists.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Poltergeists? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 50.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (sighs) Alright, ghosts. And not Casper the friendly kind either. Cyrus had a thing for hunting the more powerful of the species. Why, I got no idea.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't want to go through it again.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You know, you're right. I've wasted enough time on small minds tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I was talking about your father.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me... did you say hunted?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Yup, and his trophies are all locked up in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: This basement?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What's with you people? Are you slow? Of course this basement. If it was next door I wouldn't give a shit. Here, I'll prove it... Rafkin pulls out his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You can see them with these. They're spectral viewers.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I gave Bobby a pair of those. This gets Arthur's attention. Maggie walks over and takes them out of Rafkin's hand. Slips them on.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (looking around) I don't see any ghosts... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 51.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) That's because they're all downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: «+. just more of that crazy Latin shit all over the floor. Rafkin takes the glasses back. Looks down. Impressed.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Huh. Hidden barrier spells. Cyrus must've needed more protective zones.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Protection? You mean like oregano is to a vampire?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yeah... something like that...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (had enough) Look, Raf-kin, is it? Do mea favor, spare us the haunted house ravings... at least ‘til we get outta here. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to a staircase, leading down into the basement. Arthur starts down it.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Whoa! They stop and look at him.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What did I just say? There's a petting zoo in the basement? No, Arthur, I succinctly said there are ghosts in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You also said they were locked up.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. No way. Rafkin won't budge. Arthur knows it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 52.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Listen, I'll make you a deal. I'll pay you whatever Cyrus owed you. Just... help... me... find my son. Arthur extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Deal? Arthur extends his hand. And for the first time Dennis Rafkin isn't afraid of the gesture. Not that he takes it, of course.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Deal. Rafkin pulls out a bottle of prescription drugs, swigs it down, swigs it all down, then joins them down the stairca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group comes to the bottom of the stairs, then moves into the glass-lined passage. Rafkin's head is beginning to throb again. Arthur, taking note.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just keep an eye on me, okay? The four search the empty basement hallways, finding nothing but more glass and shadows. They come to an intersection in the huge labyrinth. Rafkin checks one of the containment cubes, finding its door still locked.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: The place is too big. Kathy and I'll go this way, you two head down there.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Sure. Ignore the professional... Look, don't go too far. A straight line then turn around. We'll meet back in five -- alright? Arthur nods. Takes Kathy by the arm, and they head off in one direction, leaving Maggie and Rafkin to go the other CuT TO:  50 51

dialogues.speaker: 51A
dialogues.text: 52 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the hour the huge gears turn again. Faster than before. We MOVE PAST them, IN ON the control panel. Three levers shift, and the sign of the jackal, along wit others, slides forward, clicking into place. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM the BACK of the house, we see the ARCHITECTURE SHIFTING as if under orders, the huge EDIFICE GROANING with Herculean effort. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Kathy and Arthur, and elsewhere near Rafkin and Kalina three more doors slide open, unnoticed. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is exactly what Rafkin didn't want to hear... especially in the basement. Maggie doesn't look too worried about things. Taking things rather nonchalantly, while Rafkin appears the frightened rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Look, you don't believe me, do you? See for yourself... Rafkin puts the Ghost Glasses on Maggie, and pulls her in front of the first glass cube.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I thought we've been over this. I can't see any ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: There. Rafkin points into one of the cubes.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Where? Maggie looks around intently, but comes back confused. Rafkin looks at her, wondering. He pulls the glasses off her face and puts them on his own. He's shocked. The first two cubes are empty. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 54.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (panicking) Oh, no... Rafkin paces in front of the cubes. He peers worriedly into the next cube. At first he sees nothing, when suddenly, a hammer slams against the glass. Rafkin whoops and jumps backwards. He grabs his heart.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Never fails... they always wait for you to put your face right up near the glass... Maggie eyes him warily. Rafkin takes off the glasses and puts them on Maggie. She looks into the cube. And screams.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST GLASSES
dialogues.text: A hugely-built middle-aged BLACK MAN appears, dressed in layers of viciously torn leather, with a blacksmith apron covering what remains. In addition, nails and spikes are hammered into his body, from his head down to the sledge- hammer that's been nailed to his handless arm.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God... it's a... it's a...

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
