dialogues.text: That's right, we're surrounded by ‘em all the time. Most of ‘em can't hurt us. Most of ‘em don't want to hurt us... but there are exceptions. The apparition glares at Rafkin. He takes hold of a spike embedded deep in his shoulder and pulls. All eight inches of rusting metal comes out. He thrusts it at the glass, and pulls it across the surface in a shower of sparks, as if carving a hello from Hell.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Just saying hi. I helped put him here. The ghost lowers his spike. Into the glass he has etched the phrase "U MYN." Dennis takes a beat, then licks the glass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 53 54 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 54a.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (acting tough to ghost) I love you too. Lightning quick, the apparition lifts his hammer and smashes it against the glass. Sparks explode across the corridor. Maggie jumps back into Rafkin's arms.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Okay, I wanna go now... Maggie swallows hard. Rafkin, half smiling, gestures down the corridor, and reluctantly, she follows. At the last moment, Rafkin turns and flips the hammer the bird. But the ghost is gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby lies on the floor. He rises, shaky, turns -- and realizes that he's trapped in a space perhaps twenty feet wide by ten feet long, surrounded on all four sides by glass walls. Other spaces are dimly visible through the glass. He looks around. No way out. Then, on the other side of the glass wall, he sees Arthur moving down the passage on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad! But Arthur cannot hear or see him. An instant later, Kathy comes INTO VIEW...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kathy! Kathy! Dad! He bangs on the glass, but his fists hardly make a sound.  55 56 57 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur hurries forward. Kathy behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad, slow down...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Bobby! ! Arthur charges forward, searching. Kathy stays close.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: We're gonna get lost... And on that note, Arthur turns the corner, and finds Bobby's microphone and glasses lying in the middle of the corridor floor. He stops in his tracks. Kathy notices them too. Both of them fear the worst. They slowly walk over to the items. Arthur picks up Bobby's microphone, while Kathy grabs his glasses. Arthur presses PLAY on the RECORDER -- Bobby's last words bellow out.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (screaming on recorder) Dad! Dad!! Arthur quickly clicks the RECORDER OFF. He tries to keep it together, but we can see the pain on his face. Kathy breaks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Bobby's side of the wall, Bobby pounds on the glass as he sees Arthur comfort Kathy with a hug.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad! Kath! Here! I'm in here! The wall behind him begins to move -- pushing in. He gasps, and scrambles back as it comes forward, the space in which he's trapped in getting narrower. And to make matters worse, Arthur and Kathy vanish from his sight behind the "trick" glass. Bobby's about to lose it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's comforting his daughter. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 56.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll find him. Kathy pulls it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Maggie pass another empty cube. The symbol on the open door gets Rafkin's attention.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: The Jackal's loose. We got to get the hell out of here. He turns back the way they came. Maggie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy holds up the glasses to her father.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad, Bobby was wearing these. Maybe Rafkin was right. Maybe there really are --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy, think about what you're saying... Kathy raises the glasses to her face...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ... there's no such thing as -- ++. revealing a face from Hell before her -- the Jackal.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH GHOST GLASSES
dialogues.text: With unnaturally long limbs and fingers with long, jagged nails; its sloping head and bulging eyes contained in the cage it wears on his head, the Jackal stands before Kathy in a shredded straitjacket, half torn off, half burned away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He supplies a madman's grin, saliva dripping, baring unnaturally large, crooked teeth, and then suddenly, when a heartbeat can seem like an eternity, he leaps at Kathy as if shot out of a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Kathy screams as she's literally propelled down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the corridor, Kathy is seen being dragged invisibly across the floor, pinned to the wall, then dragged up it to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Daddy! Help me!! Oh God!! Her clothes are shredded from her body.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Arthur, running --

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Daddy, help me! Arthur, without glasses, can't see the Jackal, but he can see the impossible spectacle of an invisible something savagely tearing his daughter apart.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy! What is it? I can't see a thing! Arthur grabs Kathy, tries to drag her away. But the Jackal won't let go. Kathy is hoisted in the air between the two, a tug of war that's killing her. Arthur won't let go of her hands and the invisible Jackal won't let go of her feet. Bloody scratches rip open along her legs as her clothes are ripped to shreds.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Make it let go! Make it let go!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Where is it?! Kathy, tell me where it is -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Arthur grabs all the material he can and pulls. It tears. Kathy rebounds, almost falling. The Jackal leaps on her like a hellish animal, scratching her with both fingers and toes. She screams over and over. Arthur sees bloody scratches appear on Kathy's skin, deep, red, sharp.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, get off! Get off! Hysterical, Arthur finally pulls Kathy up and drags her down the passage. The Jackal leaps again, yanking her fro Arthur's grasp. Arthur barely catches hold of Kathy's arm and pulls. But the Jackal's too strong... and he's losing her... Suddenly, the corridor lights up behind him, and a phosphorous flare is tossed to the floor beside him. The JACKAL SHRIEKS with unearthly horror! A second set of hands grabs hold of Kathy and pulls alongside Arthur. Arthur turns and comes face-to-face with Kalina, knapsack slung over her shoulder, glasses on her face. He does a double-take, then --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Who the hell're you?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Pull!! Together, the two pull Kathy down the hall, away from the Jackal. The Jackal regains his wits and attacks. It's a race now.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Run, goddammit!!! Arthur and Kalina drag Kathy down the hall, trying to outrun the Jackal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing gives chase, closing the gap in the blink of an eye. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Hurry, Daddy!! At the last possible moment, the Jackal leaps. Kathy screams again. The Jackal suddenly slams into an invisible barrier. Kathy reacts with astonishment as the ghost rips and tears into the barrier like a wild animal trying to get at meat... sparks fly. The trio tries to regain themselves around the corner. Kathy's in Arthur's arms, cut, bruised, crying. He looks up with fire in his eyes at Kalina --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Just who the hell are you, how the hell did you get in here, and what the hell was that!? CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The duo weave their way through the basement's maze of glass trying to locate Arthur and Kathy. Rafkin pulls Maggie along, trying to find the way out, but it's no use. The hallways all look the same. Pulling her around a corner, they find themselves trapped. A glass barrier cuts them off from the rest of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Shit!! Gotta go back. Rafkin grabs Maggie, turns, suddenly stops. He looks down the hall. Maggie isn't sure why. Rafkin starts backing up.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: What? What!?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don't talk. Don't move. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 60.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Why?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Somehow we got behind enemy lines. Hands her the glasses. Maggie can see a tiny boy carrying a hatchet moving towards them in the dark. She turns back towards Rafkin for affirmation. When she looks back --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It's gone... Rafkin takes the glasses back. Looks --

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: No, it's not. It's hiding. OFF Maggie's terrified reaction, we... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Kalina is helping Arthur tear up strips of cloth to bind Kathy's wounds.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Kalina Oretzia. I'm in the spirit reclamation business.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Spiritua-recla-what?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I free trapped souls. Your Uncle --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Forget my uncle, and trapped souls for a second. What in the world are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Looks like I'm saving your ass.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (nervously) Dad... it's still there... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kathy passes the glasses to her father. He holds them for an instant, then puts them on. The Jackal's some three feet away -- scratching insanely at the glowing red spells that block his way.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (studying the Jackal) Unbelievable...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Another one of your uncle's victims.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (turns to Kalina) Victims? When Arthur looks back, the Jackal's gone...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, your uncle had a nasty habit of enslaving souls. That's why I'm here. It doesn't matter whether they're dead or not, they're still people. Kathy looks up, bloody, trembling, angry, like this woman's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: How the hell did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I eased in through an opening when the house shifted. Kathy looks to her father with hope.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Don't get your hopes up. It's closed now, and it's not gonna happen again.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: But if you got in --

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Here... Kalina pulls out a huge ancient book from her satchel. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 62.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: The Arcanum. It belonged to my fiance. He and your uncle had the only two known copies in the world. Kalina flips through the book.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: It was penned in the fifteenth century by an astrologer named Basileus. In it he describes the building of a certain device. One that can see into the future, As legend has it, it was described to him while under demonic possession. (beat) Needless to say, his book didn't make the Best Seller's List. After reading it, the church burned him at the stake. His writings, however, survived. (looking around) I just can't believe he built it...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Basileus' device. The Eye of Hell. (beat) You're standing in the middle of a machine designed by the Devil... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Maggie continue down the dark corridor. A figure moves in and out of shadows following them. Rafkin notices the lurking ghost with the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: We got company... He hurries Maggie down the corridor. Suddenly, another figure, the Suicide, crosses the corridor in front of them, slipping into the shadows. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 63 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 63.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: See what? I don't have glasses, you moron. Rafkin backs down the hall, Maggie behind him. He catches a quick glimpse of the first figure again. This time it's closer. He re-checks the other corridor, and the Suicide is there

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (nervous ) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: If it's down here it's not a good thing, trust me. Rafkin spins around, and the '50s kid is on top of him. He swings his bat madly at Rafkin, connecting on the last swing. Rafkin, in an explosion of sparks, goes sailing. Maggie quickly scoops Rafkin up and starts hauling him down the corridor with the Suicide in pursuit. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Arthur addresses Kalina as Kathy looks on.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Look, I don't give a damn about any machine, any devil, anybody named Basileus anything except getting my family the hell out of here. Now if that book showed you how to get in, can it show us how to get out?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Possibly -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 64.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Finally. We're on to something here. We're communicating. This is good. All we need is a little cooperation from you and that book, and we can all go home. Correct?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll help you get out but you, in turn, have to help me. I came here to free those trapped by your uncle. Tonight. You want out? You have to help me, too.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Do I have a choice?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I could free us all. Here. Now. Kalina opens her bag, exposing sticks of dynamite. Arthur swallows hard. This wasn't the option he had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Al-right... this is negotiable. (beat) Kathy, can you walk -- ? Arthur turns around to see -- Kathy's gone.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Kathy! Kathy!!! Arthur searches everywhere, but it appears that Kathy's just vanished.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No!! This can't be happening!! Kalina watches him lose it. She notices something move above her.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: C'mon, we gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere without my kids!

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Try telling him that. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 64A
dialogues.text: 65 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kalina gestures to a little boy ghost standing on the ceiling. The ghost issues a hateful, unholy hiss. Arthur notices him and quickly changes his mind. They flee down the corridor, until they finally see the stairs coming up. Freedom. One last corner to go, when -- wham -- show's over. A sheet of glass blocks their path to the stairs. What's worse is that when they turn around -- the ghost is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Shit... where'd he go...? OFF their panicked looks, we... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We MOVE IN ON the huge clockworks. They spin at a tremendous speed now. We pull into the control panel mechanism. The symbols shift, and the 9th meter, the sign of the HAMMER slides forward... and CLICKS into plac And the house begins to move again... releasing the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Maggie rush forward. Maggie's on edge, her eyes darting around, checking all the dark corners of the corridors. The HOUSE suddenly begins to MOVE again. At the end of the HALLWAY a door opens, while walls around them start t CLOSE IN and crush them.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Look out! Move! Rafkin shoves her out of the crushing hallway, as the wall forces him into the open doorway. The glass WALL SLAMS CLOSED between them, and the house goes silent again. Stops moving. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Maggie can see each other through the glass. Rafkin notices the glasses in Maggie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Great... His head begins pounding. Something's not right. Then he turns around, and realizes where he is...

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... go around to the door and toss me the glasses. Maggie walks around the corner, and sees the Suicide standing there. She quickly backpedals back to where she was before.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: That idea ain't gonna work, you gotta plan B? She looks back THROUGH the glass for Rafkin, and spots -- The Hammer is standing right behind him, smiling. Rafkin reacts to Maggie's panicked look.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (mouthing) What? The Hammer raises his weapon, about to swing down on Rafkin. Maggie quickly points to the side away from the Hammer.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Move! Rafkin jumps over as the Hammer swings. The Hammer strikes the floor where Rafkin just was. Sparks fly. Rafkin nervously looks at Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (mouthing) The spells? Where... are... the... spells? Maggie checks the floor. She notices the glowing spells, but Rafkin's not standing on them. The Hammer's now gone... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 66A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Maggie pushes both of her hands forward.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Back!! Rafkin hops back, like a little frog, just as the Hammer reappears and swings, missing Rafkin and hitting an invisible wall. More sparks fly. Rafkin's sweating profusely now. He doesn't move. He's standing on the spells. One wrong step and he's dead. He glances around knowing the Hammer's presence is very close by. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The exit door is about ten feet away. He'd never be able to make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You have to... lead me... out. Maggie looks down at the path of spells on the floor, and it's a jagged path to the door. Then she sees the Hammer standing over Rafkin like an executioner, waiting to bring down his ax. One wrong step, and...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh, crap. Rafkin looks at her hopefully. Maggie nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Right foot. Step right.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Right? Maggie nods. Rafkin raises his right foot, hovering it over the floor, looking for Maggie to okay the step. She nods again. Rafkin takes the step. Rafkin squints, ready to get hit. But the Hammer's gone.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Whew...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Left foot.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Left foot?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Right foot? Maggie waves and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Left foot. Forward.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: It's like playing friggin' Twister here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rafkin sets his left foot forward. Again he's safe. Maggie nods, motioning him straight, onward. Another safe step. He might just make it out of here alive after all. And that's when Maggie sees the Suicide turn the corridor and she's coming right at her. Maggie, scared out of her wits, wants to run, but she still has to deal with Rafkin.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Another right. Rafkin goes to take a step with his right foot, and walk right off the spells. Maggie's not watching, she's more concerned with the Suicide heading in her direction. Maggie turns back just in time and sees the Hammer right in front of Rafkin --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Shit! Just jump! Rafkin takes a flying leap towards the door. He makes it out safely, and rushes over to Maggie. Gives her a big "thank you" kiss on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I owe you big time.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Fine. Just get me outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin, peeking out of the basement stairwell, surveys the main floor with the glasses. Everything looks clear. But it's all the dark areas of the house. Your eyes can easily play tricks on you. Seeing movements that may or may not be there.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: See anything?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: No... that's what makes me nervous... Rafkin and Maggie move slowly through the room. Maggie's clamped onto Rafkin, petrified. CuT TO:  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy comes suddenly awake, rubbing her head. Focusing!--

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Wha-what happ -- ? She looks around the room. Bobby's sitting beside her. Dried tear streaks run down his face.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kath...

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Bobby... oh, my God... are you alright? We've been looking all over for you.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (near tears again) I saw you and Dad before. I yelled but you didn't see me. She sits up, puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Mom's here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (looks around) Where are we? What part of the house?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't know. Mom's here, Kathy. Kathy looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Here?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She's one of them. She's like in the hospital, with all those bandages on her. Kathy doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Do you believe me? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 70.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what to believe... Kathy holds her brother close while they wait.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kath?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I hate this house. I just wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I know, kiddo, so do I. We're gonna get out of here soon. I'm sure Dad's on his way right now. OFF her hopeful look, we... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Kalina are in front of the blocked-off staircase. Kalina's flipping through her book, studying the map of the house. Arthur keeps lookout for anything out of the ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Find anything?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Not yet. Arthur turns back around... and now, at the end of the hallway is -- the Jackal.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Oh, damn... it's back... hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I'm hurrying. But when he looks back, it's gone...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Shit... I lost it! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Arthur panics.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Do something for Christ's sake! Kalina gets in Arthur's face --

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Show. A little. Backbone. No matter how much I hated your uncle, he always managed some. The words sting Arthur, and for the first time he knows it's always been a problem. Kalina's still rifling through her book.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: If I can just pinpoint where things have moved to... Arthur peers around the corner, and the Jackal's back. Closer.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You wanna read a little faster! Our friend's back. Kalina drops her knapsack to the floor. Removes a flare from her bag. Hands it to Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Light it. It's quicksilver. Arthur IGNITES the FLARE.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: The burning metal disrupts its spiritual energy and buys us time.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: How many of these do you have left?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Three? You couldn't have brought a few more? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 71a.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I didn't plan on giving a tour of the place. (finds what she's looking for in book) Here it is... The book is opened to one of the layouts. A red square is indicated in one of the "blocks." (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: We gotta get to the library. It has spell protection all around it.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Where is it from here? Kalina shifts the book around to see where they are.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Above us, to the right. Kalina notices the glass blocks above them in the ceiling. Arthur sees where she's going with this, and we... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rafkin and Maggie have backed themselves into a corner. Rafkin's looking at two figures, the Fat Man and the Little Woman, making their way down the corridors to them.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (panicked) Just tell me when I'm supposed to scream, because I ain't gonna die without screaming my goddamn head off! Rafkin's looking at the two ghosts, the Fat Man and Little Woman, through the glasses. They quickly slip back into the darkness. He notices the pilgrims on the other end of the corridor. They're being cornered.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Not yet, but take a deep breath. Suddenly, a glass block in the floor behind them pops open, and a flare is tossed through. It lands on the floor, illuminating the corridor. The ghostly figures quickly disperse... A hand appears, and Kalina is shoved through the hole. Maggie screams. Rafkin freaks --

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What the hell --  70 71 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kalina's legs disappear through the ceiling. Arthur, holding out the flare, scans the basement around him. The figures still remain at bay. That's when the flare burns out. Arthur shakes it once, twice, then, knowing it's out for good, stands alone, helpless in the single patch of light coming from the ceiling. He looks to his left and sees the crab-like creature scurrying down the corridor. From the other direction comes a large silhouette (which is the Hammer).

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Ms. Ortezia...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Kalina notices the two of them. Rafkin recognizes her. She recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I should ask you the same question. Heretic.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hack. They both size each other up.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling up from below) Hey! Remember me?! Rafkin and Maggie peer into the hole and see Arthur below.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Pull him up! Pull him up!! Rafkin reaches his hand into the hole, and Arthur grabs it. They pull him up through the hole... just as the Hammer swings. An EXPLOSION of SPARKS ERUPTS in the basement. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Thank for taking your time. Really. Kalina rechecks the book --

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Alright, at the end of the hall, make a right... then another right... then --

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: The library. It's the safest place in the house, the walls are surrounded entirely with spells.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (re: her book) How the hell would you know? Kalina holds up the book. Rafkin ain't biting.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Arthur?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Trust her. Arthur notices the flare going out.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Now could we please just save all our questions for the library?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Alright, let's move. Kalina IGNITES another FLARE, and guides them down the corridors.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Where'd your daughter go?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I don't know. She disappeared. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 75.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: How can you lose an entire family in a glass house? Arthur tosses Rafkin a look just as they turn a corner, and the Jackal leaps out of the shadows and pounces on Arthur's back. The Jackal's tearing into Arthur, dragging him down the hallway. Kalina tosses her flare down the hall at them, and the ghost jumps off Arthur, shrieking. Rafkin quickly grabs Arthur and pulls him into the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble in.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: So much for quicksilver...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: We should be safe in here... Arthur lands on the couch, in pain. Maggie's by his side. Rafkin bangs on the glass, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Shit, you'd think I'd be used to these things by now.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: They don't seem to like you either... Kalina takes a seat at the desk, begins reading through her book.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: .-. I wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Look, you got something to say, spit it out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Alright... let's start with... this is all your fault! If you hadn't caught them, we wouldn't be running from them now, would we?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't build this house. Blame his crazy uncle for that one.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: But you helped him. How could you help him without knowing what he was up to?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I had my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: You stole people's souls for money. How depraved is that?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Before that I was working for a psychic hotline. Try that for depraved. (beat) Look, Cyrus took me in when no one else would. In case you haven't noticed... I... am... a... FREAK. Dead people give me migraines. I can't touch a single person without suddenly seeing all their problems. (beat) Do you know how lonely that is? No one accepted me except him.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: He didn't accept you. He used you. Rafkin looks away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (to Kalina) Look, cut me some slack, what difference does it make? These things are all killers anyway, so what do we care? A beat passes, Kalina turns to Rafkin -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: You didn't tell him, did you? Rafkin lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: About the fourth ghost?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: He has a right to know.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (concerned) What about the fourth ghost?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Let me help you out... St. Luke's Hospital, six months ago. The realization hits Arthur hard. He turns to Rafkin.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Jean's... here...?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I had no idea she was your wife, Arthur, I swear. Arthur clocks Rafkin with a roundhouse punch, sending him flying over the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Why? She never hurt anyone...

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: I don't know... Cyrus handpicked every one of ‘em. Your wife included. When I realized who you were I tried to help --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Tried to help?! We're trapped, my kids are missing, my wife, who should be resting in peace, is being held hostage by the house from hell, and you call this HELP?! She's right. This is all your goddamn fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rafkin takes the scolding. Arthur paces the room.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: There is a way to save her, Arthur. And your kids, too. Arthur stops pacing. Turns to her --

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: This house... it isn't a house, it's a machine. It's a complete recreation of Basileus' design. (reading from the book) According to this, there should only be twelve earthbound spirits trapped inside here. Arthur walks over and she shows him the book.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: (re: book) You see these? They're the Black Zodiac. They represent the different ghosts that Cyrus needed to catch. (reading) The Withered Lover, the First Born Son, the Torn Prince. And here... the Bound Lady, the Great Child and the Dire Mother... the Suicide, the Torso, and the Buried Maiden... then there's the three death signs, the sign of Hell's Winter... the Hammer, the Hyena, and the Juggernaut... As Kalina counts through the ghosts of Arthur, forever the math teacher, instinctively counts them off on his fingers. Kalina flips through a few more pages.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: According to Basileus, this machine requires the energy of these specific spirits in order to bring it to life. Once engaged, the spirits are freed one by one, each adding its energy to the machine... powering it up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 79.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Powering it up for what?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: To open the Ocularis Infernum.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: The Ocularis? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: It's Latin. It means the Eye of Hell.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: The Eye of Hell?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Come on, Arthur. This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I saw a man carrying his own head. The Eye of Hell isn't a stretch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: In Hell, there's an eye that sees the whole world. Past and future, heaven and earth, the blessed and the damned. If knowledge is power, then the man who controls the Ocularis would be the most powerful man on earth. Your uncle was planning to become God. A beat passes...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: So how many ghosts have been set free? Kalina checks the book.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: And it needs twelve ghosts to power it up? Rafkin shakes his head. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 80.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Uh-uh. What about this thirteenth ghost? Even Damon mentioned it.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: It's a fail safe. Yes. In order to stop the process. The house needs a sacrifice of life, instead of death. (beat) A willing... human... sacrifice. The sacrifice of the Broken Heart. All eyes turn on Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: «+. the thirteenth ghost...?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Exactly. The thirteenth spirit stands before the eye as the final configuration culminates. As the eye opens, the spirit uses the power of life to, essentially, short circuit the system.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Uses the ‘power of life'...? Kalina swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: By leaping into the eye.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Thanks for painting the picture.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (scoffing) Power of life... (re: her book) Let me see that... Rafkin studies the book, looking at it from different angles. at. It's obvious he doesn't know what he's looking A beat passes...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Isn't there any other way? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 81.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: We can try it the old-fashioned way... but nobody's going to be able to brag about it later. She opens her bag. Shows Maggie and Rafkin the dynamite. A long beat passes...

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Whatever we decide, we have to come up with a game plan soon. Time's running out. Rafkin takes a seat next to Arthur on the couch. Kalina's out of earshot, working out their plan. Arthur thinking, while fidgeting with Rafkin's Power and Light tool belt, left there from before.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Hey, I know why you feel you have to do this...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Psychics call it linking... we linked earlier. I know everything. About Jean. About you...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Believe me. You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna listen to this from you.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: But Kalina's talking suicide, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Yeah, and if it saves my kids --

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: But how do you know she's right? Think about it for a second. It just doesn't add up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 82.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: And what does? Huh, Dennis? How much of this fucking equation makes sense!? You got a better idea because I'm fresh out of sanity at the moment!?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Just think about it for a minute, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: In case you haven't been counting I'm out of time here. There aren't many options to consider, Mr. Psychic.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: What happend to Kathy and Bobby's options? You gonna give up on those, too? Arthur grabs Rafkin by the shirt and pins him to the wall. Arthur is

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You can go to hell!! You hear me, you son of a bitch!! To hell. All I can think about are my kids. Goddammit, I don't even know if they're alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just about to lose it when Rafkin approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Then let's find out, Arthur. For them. While there's still time. So you'll know. So we'll all know. After listening to Rafkin, Arthur recollects himself. One last time.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (to Kalina) No matter what happens to me, to us all, do you think you can stop the machine?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I got enough dynamite here to blow this place back to the Fifteenth Century if that's the question? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 73 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 83.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Okay. How many flares do you have left?

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: One. Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: We're going out again.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Arthur! That's crazy!! Those things out there will kill you!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Not if we take that. Arthur points at one of the doors in the library. He and Rafkin remove the hinges off the spell-etched glass door, using the tools from the belt. Written inside are the spells. He hands the door to Rafkin.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Alright... we got ourselves a Captain America shield baby.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: You have about ten minutes before the last ghost is released and the ectoplasmic shit hits the cosmic fan. Arthur nods. Maggie and Arthur share a last look, then follow Rafkin out the door of the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both holding opposite sides of the door. The corridor's empty. Covered with dark patches. They carefully inch their way down the corridor, passing dark areas. They reach a couple of dark patches, and slowly walk past. Prepared for anything... When suddenly, out of the shadows, the '50s Kid swings his bat, and smacks the door -- sparks fly.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Shit -- he's swinging for the fence. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 84.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Ram him on three... Rafkin and Arthur brace themselves. The '50s Kid continues to whack away at the door.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (fast count) One-two-three! They drive the '50s Kid into the wall. Pressing the door against him. Sparks light up the corridor. The '50s Kid is going crazy. There's a huge burst of ecto-plasmic sparks, then he vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: That's more like it. Arthur spots an opening behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: This way... Arthur guides them down another corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After flashing a flare before them, Kalina and Maggie drop through the ceiling, back into the basement. They make their way through the glass hallway, coming to a door. As Kalina approaches it, she stumbled across Ben's sliced corpse. Maggie gasps at the remains.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh... God... Looks like we found the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Hold the flare still. I'm almost there. Kalina reaches around the doorway, clicks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GEARS are spinning and GRINDING at the highest speed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kalina quickly rushes over to the base of the machine with the Arcanum, trying to figure out how it works. A shadow figures moves past the door outside the clockworks room.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I'm working on it! Kalina's following the manual. She studies the different levers and what each does. Maggie turns and comes face-to-face with Cyrus's ghost. She jumps, then quickly jabs the flare at him. But to her surprise, he doesn't react... Instead, he takes a step towards her. She tries to ward him off again with the flare... but he takes another step.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Damn... Kalina... you better get over here... this shit ain't workin' anymore! Maggie's panicking... and then her flare starts to go out.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Hurry your ass up! Maggie backs up... and she's hit over the head from behind. She lands on the floor and goes out like a light. Cyrus's ghost approaches the body. And so does Kalina... The faint flare illuminates both of them. In Kalina's hand, we see the Arcanum. It's obvious she just struck Maggie with it. Kalina removes her glasses, and looks over at Cyrus's ghost. He's still there, hasn't vanished. They embrace and kiss. And then the flare completely goes out, plunging the room into darkness, and we... CuT TO:  76 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 85A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Rafkin are still walking the halls, wearing glasses. They're on edge, nervously looking in all directions. At any moment, something could jump out of the shadows at them.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: ‘There's no place like home, there's no place like home...'

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Knock it off. Rafkin spots the Hammer appear behind Arthur at the end of the hall. The Hammer makes eye contact with Rafkin, and charges.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Before Arthur even has time to turn around, Rafkin heroically shoves Arthur into the corner, pinning him safely behind the shield. Rafkin turns and faces the charging Hammer. He's leaning back on the glass, preventing Arthur from getting out.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (behind the door) What're you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it, Arthur... I've been looking for a reason to like myself for a long time now. The Hammer approaches, but Rafkin's not running. The Hammer stops right in front of Rafkin. Rafkin gulps. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (behind glass) Dennis, no! Don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (to the Hammer) Hey, big guy, no hard feelings, huh? (stops himself) Who am I kidding... look at you... The Hammer prepares to strike, when -- A TERRIFYING HOWL comes from the belly of the house. It gets everyone's attention, even the ghosts...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) Christ... (to Arthur) We're out of time... Rafkin turns back to the Hammer, who grins an evil grin. Then strikes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: releasing Another HOWL ECHOES through the room. Cyrus and Kalina watch as the 12TH SIGN lines up and CLICKS into place... the Breaker. Kalina turns to him pissed.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: You know, it's one thing for me to have spent all that time with that idiot Damon, kill him, and then steal his spells -- now I gotta babysit your stupid nephew so he doesn't get himself killed before you need him. Enough is enough, Cyrus.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: But you did bring me Damon's spells, right? Kalina removes the book from her bag. She tears the leather covering off the back of the book, and inside is a thin reel of audio tape. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 78 79 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 87.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: I got your spells. But a deal's a deal, remember, we share everything... fifty-fifty. Cyrus snatches it from her, holds it up to the light, and examines it. Smiles when he realizes they're authentic.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Don't you worry, Kalina, you'll get everything you deserve. Cyrus places a reel-to-reel machine on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hammer swings on Rafkin, who dodges the attack. The strike WHACKS the GLASS, sparks fly, Arthur reacts.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (getting cocky) That the best you can do? My mother hits harder than that. The Hammer's now enraged. He swings again... and again Rafkin dodges the strikes, bobbing and weaving, like Ali in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: You ain't got no speed, old man. What's the matter, that hammer weighing you down? The Hammer's swinging wildly, but Rafkin, surprisingly, has quicker reflexes, and it's pissing the Hammer off. Rafkin evades another attack, and out of the corner of his eye, he spots the Breaker turning the corner... From his massive size, he realizes who it is.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: Mother of Christ... Arthur sees the Breaker approaching. He grows larger as he gets closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyrus is setting up a reel-to-reel machine. Kalina's beside him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: So, what're you gonna do now? Your nephew believes the sacrifice is gonna stop this thing, but you'll never get him to jump into the eye, not until he finds his kids.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Then let's give them to him... (tosses her some rope) Go tie them up.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Cyrus, I can't...

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Why not? You know as well as I do that human lives are the price of human achievement. How many lives went into the construction of the Pyramids? Or the Great Wall of China? Or the space program? It's Darwinism at its finest. (beat) Now step aside... I need to finish setting this up. And you need to do your job... Kalina walks out of the room with the rope, and Cyrus finishes threading the reel-to-reel machine with the audio tape. Then he flips a switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur watches helplessly, as Rafkin is smacked by the Hammer, right into the Breaker's arms.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: No!! Arthur pushes the glass off him to get out, but the Breaker slams Rafkin into the glass, which again pins Arthur behind it. Rafkin tries to crawl away, but the Hammer smashes him over the back with his hammer. Rafkin is bloody and bruised, on his last legs. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 89.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Arthur once again tries to push the glass off him to get out, but Rafkin slaps his bloody hand on the glass. Makes eye contact with Arthur. Shakes his head, telling Arthur not to come out.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (slurring) Save your kids... The Breaker picks Rafkin up and smashes him against the glass door. His broken body leaves a bloody smear as it slides to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Dennis!! Arthur sinks to his knees, crushed. He looks up and the ghosts are gone. He completely falls apart... Then suddenly, another ghost appears on the other side of the glass. Arthur looks up and sees -- Jean, as we saw her before, standing there, staring at him. Arthur looks at her, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Jean...? She tilts her head in response, sadness and longing in her face. Arthur can't hold it back anymore, a wave of emotion rushes over him and he bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry... please forgive me... (sobbing) I should've went back in after you...

dialogues.speaker: I --
dialogues.text: Jean looks at him, shakes her head, letting him know he did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I miss you so much... Arthur reaches out and places his hand against the glass to touch her on the other side, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyrus finishes setting up the REEL-TO-REEL, then he switches ON the MACHINE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 83 84 85 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 90.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A CHANTING sound (the spells being read over and over), very similar to what was used to lure the Breaker in the opening scene, comes OVER the SPEAKERS in the house, only these are richer in tone and texture. Stronger. Cyrus turns to Kalina --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Time to finish this... CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTS 82
dialogues.text: reacting with revulsion as they're engulfed by the CHANTING. They slowly begin to vanish one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur has his hand on the glass. Jean's about to put her hand against his, when the CHANTING sound hits her... and her hand slowly fades out of sight. Arthur watches her disappear in front of him... leaving Arthur Kriticos completely alone. A beat passes... then Arthur looks up and sees -- Kathy and Bobby rising out of the center island of the Ocularis in the great hall. Tied back to back they are helpless. OFF Arthur's reaction, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyrus steps over Maggie's body, heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: The final configuration's starting... gather your things, let's go... Kalina picks up her knapsack. Then abruptly, she hears a HISS, turns -- Cyrus has stepped through an open doorway on the neighboring wall, and that DOOR has just snapped shut. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Cyrus? Cyrus presses a stud. There's another HISS. Kalina turns pale. The door separating her from the fallen Maggie has just slid aside. She turns to Cyrus --

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Cyrus! Stop screwing around! Let me outta here!

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Good-bye, my dear... thanks for all your help. Maybe we'll see each other again on the other side. He smiles, hits another switch. The walls surrounding Kalina begin closing in on her.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Motherfu -- She kicks the glass! Tries holding it back, no use. It keeps coming. Panic starts to set in. The glass moves in closer. Finally pinning her.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Oh, God... no... please... Her face is pressed up against the glass, her breasts flattened. Her eyes go wide. She starts to scream and scream... We start to hear the SNAPPING of RIBS. Her arms narrower than her body, claw uselessly at the glass.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Aaabh... Her head, now turned sideways, is being pressed flatter and flatter... abruptly there's a ghastly dull CLUNK as her SKULL SPLITS and blood and brains splatter out. The walls continue to close, crushing her body, flattening, distending it, until there is nothing recognizable. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 86 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 92.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And still the walls keep closing, until the entire inner surface, from wall to wall and floor to ceiling is filled with a microscopically thin red smear that was once Kalina. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHANTING is ECHOING through the house. The Ocularis has begun to spin with Kathy and Bobby still seated in the center. One of the OUTER RINGS is slowly circling around them, when it suddenly LIFTS UP, swirling around them like a blade.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Kathy!

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Don't look!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna look! Then the SECOND OUTER RING FLAPS UP next, and begins spinning in the opposite direction. Arthur appears in the doorway to the great hall. The kids spot him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Dad!! Arthur sees their predicament. Raises his glasses. Along with them are the ghosts surrounding the kids, each standing next to their symbols along the outermost ring.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Daddy... get us out of here...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Just don't move. Arthur approaches the outer ring, just as a THIRD INNER RING FLAPS UP, spinning in yet another direction, creating the combination of a meat grinder and a mixer. The Ocularis is working its way closer to the kids -- The kids slouch down.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Make it stop, Dad! Make it stop!

dialogues.speaker: 86B
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur notices Cyrus's ghost standing at the end of the corridor, a spectator to the deadly game. He's taken aback by the old man's presence, finally recognizing him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Cyrus...? (losing it) Damn you for building this place! Cyrus doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Do something! Help me save the kids! The ghost raises his hand, pointing into the Ocularis, motioning for Arthur to jump in... and that will stop everything. A FOURTH INNER RING FLAPS UP, working its way closer to the center. The kids are freaking out. Arthur looks from his kids, to the spinning rings, and back to Cyrus again. He wrestles with what he should do... Then his eyes land on Jean. She looks so sad, staring at her hysterical kids, helpless. Arthur's choice is made. He steps up to the Ocularis, standing in front of the spinning gears. He prepares himself for what he's about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur starts forward into the hall, ready to take his place amongst the ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (to kids) I want you guys to know... I love you both more than anything. The kids realize what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dad! Don't!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Daddy! It kills Arthur to see them like this. He can't let them die and make the same mistake he made before. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 94,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He'd never be able to live with himself. This is his chance to redeem himself for Jean.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: It's the only way. I'm sorry. Take care of each other... Arthur takes a long look around at the macabre scene before him. First, to the ghosts that circle the Eye, each still trapped in his or her own hell. Then Arthur focuses on the blades that swirl around him, threatening to dice his family, all that he loves. Then Arthur looks down into the fiery mechanical purgatory that is the Eye of Hell, its gigantic GEARS GRINDING away, the steel bathed in crimson light, driving the house/machine toward its fantastic culmination. Finally to the symbols on the outer ring that flash by at Arthur's feet. The whole effect does something to Arthur. Especially the mesmerizing symbols flying by. We suddenly INTERCUT WITH:

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: flipping by in the library in FLASHBACK, as Kalina was explaining the ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: (in FLASHBACK) According to this, there should only be twelve earthbound spirits trapped inside here. We --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR'S HAND
dialogues.text: doing something a math teacher does naturally -- counting off with his fingers. The symbols float by in Arthur's gaze in SLOW MOTION. We --

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 86C
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 11/1/00 95.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: Her explanation.

dialogues.speaker: KALINA
dialogues.text: The Withered Lover, the First Born Son, the Torn Prince. And here... the Bound Lady, the Great Child and the Dire Mother... the Suicide, the Torso, and the Buried Maiden... then there's the three death signs, the sign of Hell's Winter... the Hammer, the Hyena, and the Juggernaut... Arthur takes in each of the ghosts, confirming Kalina's description. We --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR'S OTHER HAND
dialogues.text: He's still tallying up the number of ghosts he's counting off in his head. 9-10-11... 12. Twelve.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Twelve. Arthur flashes back to the library one final time. This time it's Rafkin doing the talking.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: (in FLASHBACK) It just doesn't add up. Arthur holds his hands before his eyes. 12. There are twelve ghosts on the ring.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: If I'm the thirteenth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks back into the hallway. There still stands Cyrus's ghost. Arthur slowly takes off his glasses. Cyrus is still standing there.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You... son-of-a-bitch... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 11/1/00 96.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cyrus realizes he's been made. Arthur runs over and grabs his uncle, throwing him into the wall. Arthur throws a punch, landing a hard right on Cyrus.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Stop the machine! Arthur punches Cyrus again. And again. Cyrus stumbles backwards, regains himself, smiles, then goes after Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Well, well... it's nice to see you have some of the family blood in you after all. The two men go at it. Arthur's fighting for his life. He's like a wild man, throwing everything he's got, hitting Cyrus everywhere. In the face, the body...

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You took away everything I loved, you monster. Everything! (with every blow) Now. I. Want. It. Back! But Arthur has never been a warrior. Cyrus, spotting his opportunity, retaliates. Cyrus connects with Arthur in the face, knocking him down. Then he kicks Arthur in the gut a few times, making sure he stays down.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: How dare you stand in the way of history, Arthur! You are nothing, you hear me. Nothing! I dedicated my entire life to this. Every goddamn day. When have you ever shown that kind of dedication? Huh? To anything?! He kicks Arthur repeatedly, like a sick mind kicking a dog to death.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: You make me sick.

dialogues.speaker: CLOCKWORKS ROOM 87
dialogues.text: Maggie slowly comes to, awakened from the irritating noise of the CHANTING. The huge gear works before her are spinning madly now. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 88 THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 11/1/00 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She notices Kalina's bloody, squashed remains in the glass beyond.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (reacting to Kalina) Jesus... (rubbing her head) Man, what is that noise?! Then she notices the reel-to-reel machine on the table. Maggie reaches the machine and looks for an off switch. Can't find one. The CHANTING sound is unbearable. She finally shoves the MACHINE off the table, and it goes CRASHING to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur regains himself... when Cyrus appears over him.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: (out of breath) The world hasn't time for small people, Arthur. People like you, or Dennis. Or Kalina. It needs those who are willing to do anything, without question, for what they believe in.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch! Arthur rises to attack, but Cyrus stops him with a steel sword he pulls from his cane. He points the blade beneath Arthur's chin. Arthur's eyes dart around, searching for a last way out. Cyrus spots Arthur thinking...

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Arthur. Unlike Jean, you haven't got a choice this time. Now make the sacrifice. Or your. Children. Will. Die. The CHANTING sound suddenly ENDS. Silence. Cyrus looks around in shock and confusion. As does Arthur. That's when he sees Bobby's scooter come rolling behind Cyrus from the other side of the corridor. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 88A
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 11/1/00 98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Arthur quickly seizes the moment and kicks Cyrus's legs, throwing him off balance and stumbling backward, right into the path of the scooter. Like a banana peel, Cyrus slips on it and lands on his ass. Arthur scoops up the cane, as Cyrus struggles to get back to his feet. When Cyrus turns back around, Arthur cracks him across the chest with the cane... sending Cyrus sailing down the hall. He lands at the opening of the Great Hall, stunned by what just happened. He glances back at the scooter, then over to where it came. Nothing. He slips on his glasses for a moment, and there standing casually in the corridor is the ghost of Dennis Rafkin.

dialogues.speaker: RAFKIN
dialogues.text: ... never bet against human nature, Arthur. You'll always lose. Arthur smiles in thanks. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: just as he comes to on the floor. He looks up and there's nothing there. Arthur puts on his glasses and sees 12 very deadly ghosts standing around Cyrus. The ghosts of the house reach down and grab Cyrus --

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Get away!! No!!!! Arthur watches as the ghosts tear into Cyrus. It'sa feeding frenzy. The last one in to tear in is the Breaker. Cyrus suffers a horrible ending.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Let me go! Noo!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cyrus is borne into the hall on the shoulders of the ghosts he enslaved. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 11/1/00 A98A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's floating in, kicking and screaming all by himself.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The children aren't sure what to think. They only know they too will join their uncle unless something happens. Their father rushes to the door --

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (to his kids) Don't look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghosts lift Cyrus above their heads, all bloody and broken bones, bleeding and mangled... and throw him into the spinning gears of the Ocularis. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 88C
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 98A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Blood and Bones and flesh go flying. This, and the damage Maggie has caused down in the basement causes the Ocularis to go haywire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie stands before the mad machine as it whirls out of control.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet Lord. What did I do? Maggie backs toward the door. The clockworks are breaking apart all around her. She tries the handle. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Mutherfucka...! The clockworks begin flying apart. Gears and bits of machinery start bursting through the glass walls of the clockworks room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GREAT GLASS GROANS DEEPLY as the torquing of the clockworks causes sheets of glass to fall from their frames. Two more rings have FLIPPED UP, the blades getting closer to the center of the Ocularis and the kids. GLASS begins to BREAK UP all around Arthur. Shards of glass rain down. He knows he hasn't much time. Kathy holds Bobby close, protecting him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Daddy! ! Arthur doesn't know what to do, but he does know that he can't leave them there the same way he did with Jean.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Just hang on! I'm coming! Arthur backs up, and takes a running jump through the spinning blades, just barely landing on the center island of the Ocularis, with Kathy and Bobby. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: 88F
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 98B.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks for a way off but between the glass and the blades he knows there's no way they're getting out of there. Arthur holds them both tight, covering their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Don't move! Keep your head down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maggie's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: Huge bits of the clockworks come flying out the walls of the clockworks room, SHATTERING all the GLASS in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOUSE starts to BLOW APART. Glass rains down. Arthur holds his kids tight. The HOUSE is CRUMBLING all around them. The only place that's safe is where the three of them are standing. The FURY builds to a CRESCENDO of destruction, and then finally COLLAPSES! Followed by silence... Dust and smoke everywhere, blurring our vision. As it begins to dissipate, three figures slowly come INTO FRAME. Arthur, Kathy and Bobby are standing on the only remaining section of the house left... the center island of the Ocularis. All around them lies what's left of the house. A veritable skeleton of steel. The three of them open their eyes to survey the destruction.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: You guys okay? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTEEN GHOSTS - Rev. 10/27/00 98C.

dialogues.speaker: 88F CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bobby nods.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: How did you know we'd be safe here?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I didn't. I just wasn't about to leave you guys. Kathy pulls her father into a tight hug, she's teary- eyed.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I love you, too. As they look up, they notice Jean, standing on the outer ring, circling around them. She's back to looking like her old healthy self, and she's smiling at her family. As she passes around them again... she's gone. Arthur pulls his kids close, and that's when they hear --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's it! They all turn to see Maggie crawling out of the basement stairwell. She's a mess, she turns to Arthur and the kids --

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'm through with this nanny shit. This was not in the job description. I'm sorry, you guys, but I quit... I quit. This puts a smile on Arthur, Kathy and Bobby's faces, as we... FADE OUT.
